thread.title: Bernie Sanders will never, ever be president, Washington Post declares
thread.title_full: Bernie Sanders will never, ever be president, Washington Post declares

author: Douglas Perry | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Bernie Sanders will never, ever be president, Washington Post declares
text:
Comments 
Barack Obama, as presidents do, got the headline with his declaration that Republican front-runner Donald Trump would not be the next president. "He is, you know, the classic reality-TV character," Obama said Sunday night on CBS' "60 Minutes." 
But the Washington Post's Chris Cillizza has offered some presidential-campaign prognostication of his own, and, unlike Obama, he backed it up with data. 
On NBC's "Meet the Press" on Sunday, host Chuck Todd asked Senator Bernie Sanders if he was a capitalist. "No. I'm a Democratic Socialist," the Vermont independent replied. 
"And, in those five words, Sanders showed why -- no matter how much energy there is for him on the liberal left -- he isn't getting elected president," Cillizza wrote Monday . 
WaPo's White House reporter then offered poll results to support his conclusion. At least 50 percent of Americans -- including, needless to say, plenty of the folks Occupy Wall Street called the 99 percent -- love capitalism. And very, very few Americans -- only 3 percent -- think well of socialism. 
Americans generally view socialists more negatively than Muslims and atheists, Cillizza wrote. 
So if you've been impressed by Sanders' surge in the Iowa and New Hampshire Democratic presidential polls and have jumped on his bandwagon, enjoy it while it lasts, Cillizza wrote. He added: 
"The simple political fact is that if Sanders did ever manage to win the Democratic presidential nomination -- a long shot but far from a no shot at this point -- Republicans would simply clip Sanders's answer to Todd above and put it in a 30-second TV ad. That would, almost certainly, be the end of Sanders's viability in a general election." 
Unless, if you accept President's Obama's analysis of the race, Trump is his opponent. 
-- Douglas Perry
